intro: Calea senecioides, commonly known as the sacred plant or Mexican ghost flower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is characterized by its striking, white, star-shaped flowers that bloom at night, attracting nocturnal pollinators. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its medicinal properties used by indigenous communities. Its leaves are often used in traditional herbal remedies for their purported calming effects. The plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade.
